answer.text: UnifyWeaver requires SWI-Prolog, a comprehensive Prolog environment. SWI-Prolog provides the runtime for executing UnifyWeaver's declarative specifications and compiling them to target languages. This is a meta-prerequisite - install once before starting any UnifyWeaver work.

code_blocks.code:
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install swi-prolog

# Arch Linux
sudo pacman -S swi-prolog

# Fedora
sudo dnf install pl

# macOS (Homebrew)
brew install swi-prolog

# Windows (winget)
winget install SWI-Prolog.SWI-Prolog

# Termux (Android)
pkg install swi-prolog

verification.failure_message: SWI-Prolog not found. Install it using the commands above.
